item.title: Capacitance
item.description: definitions theoretical :: $\Delta V=\frac{Q}{C}$ physical :: $C=\frac{\kappa\epsilon_0A}{d}$ potential energy :: $U_C=\frac{1}{2}Q\Delta V=\frac{1}{2}C(\Delta V)^2$ Capacitors capacitors in series :: $\frac{1}{C_s}=\sum_i\frac{1}{C_i}$ capacitors in parallel :: $C_p=\sum_{i}^{} C_i$

item.title: Kinematics
item.description: Newton’s Laws Without an outside force, objects at rest stay at rest, and objects in motion stay in motion Force is a multiple of mass and acceleration Every force has a an equal and opposite reaction force for isolated systems

item.title: Kirchoff's Law
item.description: Time Constants RL Circuit :: $\frac{L}{R}$ RC Circuit :: $RC$ LC Circuit :: [!Warning] WIP Kirchoff loop derivations go here

item.title: Momentum
item.description: The following is an analogy to [[physics/Kinematics#Newton’s Laws]] If impulse is zero, momentum is zero. If impulse is nonzero, momentum is nonzero Impulse is change in momentum For inelastic collisions, change in momentum is zero Momentum $$ \begin{gather} \Delta\vec{P}=m\cdot\vec{v}\ \Delta\vec{P}=0\ P_i=P_f\ \end{gather} $$

item.title: Outline
item.description: Index Mechanics [[physics/Kinematics]] [[physics/Momentum]] Electrostatics Charge Electric Field Electric Force Gaussian Surface Circuits [[physics/Resistance]] [[physics/Capacitance]] [[physics/Kirchoff]] Magnetics Magnetic Field Magnetic Flux Induced EMF Moving Rod, $E=Blv$

item.title: Resistance
item.description: definition theoretical :: $I=\frac{\Delta V}{R}$ physical :: $R=\frac{\rho l}{A}$ Resistors resistors in series :: $R_s=\sum_i R_i$ resistors in parallel :: $\frac{1}{R_p}=\sum_i \frac{1}{R_i}$
